app.title: Atlas composer
app.subtitle: Interactive cartographic visualizations for scattered territories

territory.noOverseas: No overseas territories to adjust. Select a mode that includes overseas territories in "Territories to include".
territory.checkData: Check the data or change region.
territory.adjustPosition: Adjust territory positions and scale using the sliders below
territory.dragHint: Drag territories on the map to reposition them, or use the controls below for precise adjustments
territory.grabToMove: Click and drag to move territory

parameters.resetOverrides: Reset all parameter overrides for this territory
parameters.noRelevantParametersMessage: This projection family ({family}) has no adjustable parameters for individual territories.

projectionParams.title: Projection Parameters
projectionParams.info: Adjust projection parameters to customize the view. These controls override the default atlas settings.
projectionParams.noParams: This projection type doesn't have adjustable parameters in unified mode.

global.title: Global Projection Settings
global.description: These settings control the ideal display size and base scale for your composite projection. Canvas dimensions set the SVG viewport size, while reference scale controls the zoom level of all territories.
global.scaleWarning: Changing the reference scale will affect all territories. Individual territory scale multipliers are preserved.

actions.noProjectionsFound: No projections found matching your search

export.title: Export composite projection
export.jsonDescription: JSON configuration containing all projection parameters for your custom composite.
export.usageDescription: Use this JSON configuration with the projection loader package to create your composite projection in D3.js or Observable Plot.
export.copyError: Failed to copy to clipboard. Please try again.
export.downloadError: Failed to download file. Please try again.

about.title: About Atlas composer
about.intro: An interactive tool for creating custom cartographic visualizations of countries with geographically-scattered territories using composite projections.

why.title: Why this tool?
why.description: Displaying a country and its distant territories on the same map is a cartographic challenge. How do you show regions separated by thousands of kilometers while maintaining visual coherence? This tool explores different solutions using composite projections, similar to how the Albers USA projection displays Alaska and Hawaii alongside the continental United States.

features.title: Key Features
features.compositeCustom: Build custom layouts by positioning territories interactively
features.split: View territories separately with optimized projections
features.unified: Display all territories in a single global projection
features.export: Export configurations as JSON for use with the projection loader

technologies.title: Built With
technologies.description: Vue 3, TypeScript, D3.js, Observable Plot, Pinia, Tailwind CSS, and daisyUI. Powered by Natural Earth geodata.

footer.title: Atlas composer
footer.description: Interactive cartographic visualizations for scattered territories
footer.builtWith: Built with Vue 3, D3.js, Observable Plot, and daisyUI

conicConformalFrance.name: Conic Conformal France (Composite)
conicConformalFrance.description: Optimized composite projection for France, integrating metropolitan territory and overseas departments

conicConformalPortugal.name: Conic Conformal Portugal (Composite)
conicConformalPortugal.description: Optimized composite projection for Portugal, including mainland and Atlantic archipelagos (Azores, Madeira)

conicConformalSpain.name: Conic Conformal Spain (Composite)
conicConformalSpain.description: Optimized composite projection for Spain, including mainland, Balearic Islands, and Canary Islands

conicConformalEurope.name: Conic Conformal Europe (Composite)
conicConformalEurope.description: Optimized composite projection for the European Union and its overseas territories

albersUsa.name: Albers USA (D3 Native)
albersUsa.description: D3's built-in composite projection for the United States with fixed positioning

albersUsaComposite.name: Albers USA (Composite)
albersUsaComposite.description: Enhanced composite projection from d3-composite-projections with better customization

albersUsaTerritories.name: Albers USA with Territories
albersUsaTerritories.description: Extended composite projection including Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, and Northern Mariana Islands

conicConformalNetherlands.name: Conic Conformal Netherlands (Composite)
conicConformalNetherlands.description: Optimized composite projection for the Netherlands, including mainland and Caribbean territories (Bonaire, Saba, Sint Eustatius)

conicEquidistantJapan.name: Conic Equidistant Japan (Composite)
conicEquidistantJapan.description: Optimized composite projection for Japan, including Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Okinawa

mercatorEcuador.name: Mercator Ecuador (Composite)
mercatorEcuador.description: Optimized composite projection for Ecuador, including mainland and Galápagos Islands

transverseMercatorChile.name: Transverse Mercator Chile (Composite)
transverseMercatorChile.description: Optimized composite projection for Chile, including long mainland, Easter Island, and Juan Fernández

mercatorMalaysia.name: Mercator Malaysia (Composite)
mercatorMalaysia.description: Optimized composite projection for Malaysia, including Peninsular Malaysia and East Malaysia (Borneo)

mercatorEquatorialGuinea.name: Mercator Equatorial Guinea (Composite)
mercatorEquatorialGuinea.description: Optimized composite projection for Equatorial Guinea, including Río Muni and Bioko

albersUk.name: Albers UK (Composite)
albersUk.description: Optimized composite projection for the United Kingdom, including Great Britain and Shetland Islands

transverseMercatorDenmark.name: Transverse Mercator Denmark (Composite)
transverseMercatorDenmark.description: Optimized composite projection for Denmark, including Jutland, Zealand, and Bornholm

conicConformal.name: Conic Conformal (Lambert)
conicConformal.description: Preserves angles and shapes. Ideal for mid-latitude regions

conicEqualArea.name: Conic Equal Area (Albers)
conicEqualArea.description: Preserves area. Perfect for thematic maps of mid-latitude regions

mercator.name: Mercator
mercator.description: Preserves angles and direction. Commonly used for navigation and tropical regions

conicEquidistant.name: Conic Equidistant
conicEquidistant.description: Preserves distance along meridians. Good for regions with large north-south extent

azimuthalEqualArea.name: Azimuthal Equal Area (Lambert)
azimuthalEqualArea.description: Preserves area. Excellent for polar regions and hemispheric views

azimuthalEquidistant.name: Azimuthal Equidistant
azimuthalEquidistant.description: Preserves distance from center point. Ideal for polar navigation and radio coverage maps

stereographic.name: Stereographic
stereographic.description: Conformal azimuthal projection. Excellent for polar regions

orthographic.name: Orthographic
orthographic.description: Simulates view from space. Globe-like visualization

gnomonic.name: Gnomonic
gnomonic.description: Great circles appear as straight lines. Useful for navigation route planning

equirectangular.name: Equirectangular (Plate Carrée)
equirectangular.description: Simple rectangular projection. Evenly spaced meridians and parallels

naturalEarth.name: Natural Earth
naturalEarth.description: Visually appealing world projection with balanced distortions

robinson.name: Robinson
robinson.description: Classic world map projection. Used by National Geographic

eckert4.name: Eckert IV
eckert4.description: Equal-area pseudocylindrical projection for world maps

winkelTripel.name: Winkel Tripel
winkelTripel.description: Compromise projection for general reference world maps

mollweide.name: Mollweide
mollweide.description: Equal-area pseudocylindrical. Widely used for world maps

miller.name: Miller Cylindrical
miller.description: Modified Mercator with reduced polar distortion

sinusoidal.name: Sinusoidal
sinusoidal.description: Equal-area pseudocylindrical. Simple and widely recognized

hammer.name: Hammer
hammer.description: Equal-area azimuthal variant. Excellent for world maps

armadillo.name: Armadillo
armadillo.description: Artistic polyhedral projection with unique visual appearance

polyhedralButterfly.name: Polyhedral Butterfly
polyhedralButterfly.description: Unfolded globe in butterfly shape. Educational and artistic

loximuthal.name: Loximuthal
loximuthal.description: Rhumb lines from center are straight. Maritime navigation

polyhedralWaterman.name: Waterman Butterfly
polyhedralWaterman.description: Polyhedral projection with minimal area distortion

recommendations.territoryExcellent: Excellent for this type of territory
recommendations.territoryGood: Good for this type of territory
